snippet: Faculty members expressed dismay that Harvard administrators secretly search e-mail accounts to see who had leaked a memo about cheating.
abstract: Faculty members at Harvard criticize university after revelations that administrators secretly searched e-mail accounts of 16 resident deans in effort to learn who leaked memo about student cheating scandal to news media; report of e-mail searches prolongs fallout from cheating scandal, in which about 70 students were forced to take leave for collaborating or plagiarizing on take-home final exam in government class in 2012.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Tara Merrigan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Faculty members expressed dismay that Harvard administrators secretly search e-mail accounts to see who had leaked a memo about cheating.

headline.seo: Harvard E-Mail Search Stuns Faculty Members
headline.main: Harvard Search of E-Mail Stuns Its Faculty Members
headline.print_headline: Harvard Search of E-Mail Stuns Its Faculty Members
